titles.title: Memorial Day Moment of Silence Act
A bill to amend title 36, United States Code, to encourage the nationwide observance of two minutes of silence each Memorial Day.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 11/5/2013--Introduced. Memorial Day Moment of Silence Act - Directs the President to issue an annual proclamation calling on the people of the United States to observe two minutes of silence on Memorial Day, beginning at 3:00 p.m. Atlantic standard time, in honor of the service and sacrifice of members of the Armed Forces throughout the history of the United States.
